title: Turbot Fillets with Olive Paste and Tomatoes
introduction: This delicious recipe pairs succulent turbot fillets with the rich umami of black olive paste, complemented by fresh tomatoes and aromatic basil. It's inspired by the flavors of Italy.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds turbot, sea bass, or other thick white fish fillets
2 tablespoons black olive paste, or very finely chopped mild black olives
6 fresh basil leaves, rolled and sliced crosswise into thin ribbons
instructions: Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 450Â°F. Oil a baking pan large enough to hold the fillets in a single layer.
Arrange the fillets in the pan in a single layer. Spread the fillets with the olive paste. Scatter the tomatoes and basil over the fish.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes, depending on the thickness, until the fish is just barely opaque when cut in the thickest part. Serve immediately.
